intro: Dolichokentia robusta, commonly known as the robust arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves and spadix inflorescence. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Its rhizomes are used as a starchy food source, similar to taro. The botanical features of Dolichokentia robusta make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
